definition: to come to sb's door/to call on sb
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: And when exactly did the police turn up?
sentences.chinese: 警察什么时候会找上门？

sentences.english: " he asked his daughter. "When adversity knocks on your door, how do you respond?
sentences.chinese: 他问女儿，“当逆境找上门来时，你该如何反应呢？

sentences.english: Don't just stay at home and expect a good job to come to you.
sentences.chinese: 不要只是呆在家里，指望好工作会找上门来。

sentences.english: Save time and effort by having the movers come to you.
sentences.chinese: 让搬运公司的人自动找上门来可以省时省力。

sentences.english: Didnt think the past enemies come to kill her family.
sentences.chinese: 没想到过去的仇人找上门来要置霍家于死地。

sentences.english: A man does not seek his luck, luck seeks its man.
sentences.chinese: 好运是自己找上门来的。

sentences.english: I preferred the former, but there were no obvious opportunities to do so knocking on my door.
sentences.chinese: 我更希望前者，可是，没有明显的机会找上门来。

sentences.english: But recently the very things which she had tried to get free from so well have begun to catch up with her.
sentences.chinese: 但是最近，她曾经一直尽量远离的东西开始找上门来。

sentences.english: But Valentine would secretly marry young men that came to him.
sentences.chinese: 但是瓦伦廷秘密地为找上门的年轻人证婚。

sentences.english: Opportunity rarely knocks on your door.
sentences.chinese: 机会很少主动找上门来。

sentences.english: Early this year, many people will take the initiative to come to.
sentences.chinese: 今年初开始，会有很多人主动找上门来。

sentences.english: But when the taxman comes to the door.
Once again, the black widow is back.
sentences.chinese: 我们的黑寡妇又找上门了。

definition: to drop in/to visit/to lock a door/(of a shop) to close/to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
(of an illness, debt etc) to plague sb/to preoccupy sb/difficult to get rid of
no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
(of a plot etc) to be exposed (idiom)/to come to light
to be refused entrance (idiom)/to find the door closed
